definition: classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several
some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er
a good deal of/quite a lot

sentences.english: I need some water to quench .
Oh Fiona found out she had some money in her pocket.
sentences.chinese: 哦，霏欧纳兜里带了着些钱。

sentences.english: The boys are seen with some style changes and dramatic smoky eye make up.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们看起来造型有了些变化，而且还化了烟熏妆。

sentences.english: Don't take it to heart. They are just babes and sucklings.
sentences.chinese: 不要放在心上，那些只是些乳臭未干的小子。

sentences.english: I bought some "Longjing Tea" yesterday, why don't you have some?
sentences.chinese: 我昨天刚买了些龙井茶，你尝尝看。

sentences.english: Give them some money to take their younger siblings out for ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 给他们些零花钱，让他带着他的弟妹们去买些冷饮。

sentences.english: The best ideas have to win, otherwise you don’t have good people who stay.
sentences.chinese: 最棒的点子总会胜出，除非你身边的都是些庸才。

sentences.english: You may want to make changes in your home environment.
sentences.chinese: 本周也许你会希望在你的家庭环境中做出些改变。

sentences.english: What can we say about chemical reactivity?
sentences.chinese: 我们对化学反应了解些什么呢？

sentences.english: I'll give you some advice, Mike, don't try.
sentences.chinese: 迈克，我要给你些忠告，别去试。

sentences.english: But it caused nose bleeding if having too many of the roots.
sentences.chinese: 可是，有一回吃多了些，鼻子直冒血。

sentences.english: He would learn more quickly if he worked harder.
sentences.chinese: 如果再用功些，他会学得更快。

sentences.english: She tormented me with some silly questions.
sentences.chinese: 她问了些无聊问题烦扰我。

sentences.english: What kind of hotel would you like, five-star or something simpler?
sentences.chinese: 您愿意要什么样的酒店，五星级的还是普通些的？

sentences.english: He took some anodyne to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 他吃了些止痛药来缓解疼痛。

sentences.english: Whupon do you know concerning the tenth century?
sentences.chinese: 相关十世纪的事你知道些什么？

definition: some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
a good deal of/quite a lot
